title: Fiat Chrysler, Peugeot owner PSA in talks to combine
text:
Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot owner PSA are in talks to combine in a deal that could create a $US50 billion ($73 billion) auto maker, a source familiar with the matter said.

The Wall Street Journal first reported the discussions. Fiat Chrysler shares rose sharply after the report and were up more than 7.5 per cent in late afternoon US trading. The companies had no comment.

Investors have speculated for several years that Fiat Chrysler was hunting for a merger partner. Bloomberg

Fiat Chrysler earlier this year broached a merger with French auto maker Renault that ultimately collapsed.

Investors have speculated for several years that Fiat Chrysler was hunting for a merger partner, encouraged by the rhetoric of the company's late chief executive, Sergio Marchionne. In 2015, Marchionne outlined the case for consolidation of the auto industry and tried unsuccessfully to interest General Motors in a deal.

Peugeot and Fiat Chrysler had discussed a combination earlier this year, before Fiat Chrysler proposed a $US35 billion merger with Renault. At that time, Fiat Chrysler said a deal with Renault offered more advantages than a combination with Peugeot.
description: The Italian-American auto maker may finally have found a merger partner.
